# Major Scale in F# (Mode: Mixolydian, Shape: D)

## Description
The Major scale in F# is a 7-tone scale that consists of the following notes: F# - G# - A# - B - C# - D# - E#. In the Mixolydian mode, it has a major flavor with a lowered 7th scale degree. When played in shape D, this scale is commonly used in various genres of music for its unique sound and versatility.

## Notes and Intervals
- F# (1st note - Root)
- G# (2nd note - Major 2nd)
- A# (3rd note - Major 3rd)
- B (4th note - Perfect 4th)
- C# (5th note - Perfect 5th)
- D# (6th note - Major 6th)
- E# (7th note - Minor 7th)

## Musical Genre and Flavor
The Major scale in F# (Mixolydian mode, shape D) is often used in various genres including jazz, blues, country, rock, and pop music. It provides a bright and uplifting sound with a touch of tension due to the lowered 7th scale degree, giving it a unique flavor that can evoke different emotions in the listener.

1. "Sweet Home Alabama" by Lynyrd Skynyrd
2. "Jessica" by The Allman Brothers Band
3. "Rock and Roll" by Led Zeppelin

These songs demonstrate the versatility and melodic qualities of the Major scale in F# when used in a Mixolydian mode with shape D.
